content:
I am working on a new initiative to modernize the healthcare platform for Clinical Domain, we are planning to use HL7 FHIR for interoperability needs. I am looking for models for the below subject areas
Prior Auth
Health Assessments
Health Risk Identification
Care Management
Disease Management
Health & Wellness Initiative
Healthcare Measure
Medical Equipment
Medication
Plan of Care
Procedure
Physician Referral
Social History
Clinical Activity
Clinician
Clinical Program
Health Action
Health Assessment Conductor
Health Opportunity
Health Service Case
Health Tracker
Population Stratification
PCP Referral
Family History
Clinicians on FHIR

Can you please direct me where I can find the HL7 FHIR resources for the above subject areas

@Gurumurthy Sithuraj Please read https://wiki.hl7.org/FHIR_Rules_for_asking_questions. This seems like a "Please do my homework for me" sort of question. Please spend some time reviewing the FHIR spec, particularly the page that lists the available resources and some of the domain overview sections. The mappings for several of your concepts should jump out at you as pretty obvious at a quick glance. Several of the others will only take a bit of reading/digging.

If, after reading through the section overviews and looking at the available resources in the relevant categories and reading their descriptions you're still having trouble mapping a few of them, feel free to re-post here and tell us what you've done and what options you're considering and we'd be happy to provide guidance. (It may also be helpful to provide a description of what the concepts you're mapping are defined as and what sort of data you capture for them. The same name can mean different things to different people and can potentially map to different places depending on how the name is being used.)
Hello everyone...I need help regarding the CRD order-review request
i would like to know the CRD request that would be used to sent from EHR to the payor
There are the ones with prefetch and there are the ones without it. Would like to know which one to use
Some EHRs support prefetch, others don't. Whether prefetch gets included will also depend on whether the payer service asks for it.
